title: Florentino Perez eyeing up Christian Eriksen but Zinedine Zidane would prefer Paul Pogba
text:
Real Madrid president Florentino Perez and manager Zinedine Zidane have their eye on different solutions to their midfield problem, according to ESPN.

Perez is interested in signing Christian Eriksen in January, with the Tottenham midfielder available for a cut-price fee given his contract is up next summer.

However, Zidane is believed to be keen to bring in Manchester United's Paul Pogba instead - both players were linked with the 13-time European champions throughout the summer.

Christian Eriksen was keen to move to Spain in the summer but remained in north London

Paul Pogba has made his admiration for Real Madrid obvious yet a deal is yet to be sealed

Danish international Eriksen was pushing for a move to Spain, and was willing to move on from Spurs after last season's Champions League final.

But he was unable to seal a deal, and now would prefer a move next summer, as he could request a higher signing-on bonus because he'd be joining on a free transfer.

Perez insists that an offer of around £26million would be enough for Tottenham to sell in January.

Yet Pogba remains Zidane's number one target in midfield, and thinks a potential transfer could be agreed between Madrid and United.

Real Madrid president Florentino Perez is keen for the club to push for Christian Eriksen

Real Madrid manager Zinedine Zidane is more focused on luring compatriot Paul Pogba

The Premier League club remain adamant that Pogba is not for sale, though Zidane believes Pogba's desire to move to the Bernabeu could make a deal more viable in the future.

With just under three months until the January transfer window opens, a move will depend on the situation of both players come the New Year, as well as the form and development of Madrid's current string of midfielders.

Despite just one point from two games in the Champions League so far, Real Madrid are currently top of La Liga by two points to rivals Barcelona, with El Clasico looming at the end of the month
